properties.areaDesc: Lawrence, AR; Randolph, AR; Independence, AR; Jackson, AR; Sharp, AR
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 10 at 11:30PM CST until January 11 at 12:30AM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Central Independence County in north central Arkansas...
Randolph County in eastern Arkansas...
Northeastern Jackson County in eastern Arkansas...
Lawrence County in eastern Arkansas...
Eastern Sharp County in north central Arkansas...

* Until 1230 AM CST.

* At 1130 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from 11 miles northwest of Dalton to near Ravenden to
near Strawberry to near Southside in Independence County, moving
east at 25 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations impacted include...
Batesville...                     Newport...
Pocahontas...                     Walnut Ridge...
Hoxie...                          Black Rock...
Lake Charles State Park...        Tuckerman...
Diaz...                           Newark...
Swifton...                        Imboden...
Ravenden...                       Reyno...
College City...                   Portia...
Maynard...                        Grubbs...
Biggers...                        Strawberry...

This includes US Highway 67 between mile markers 86 and 101, and
between mile markers 109 and 121.
properties.instruction:
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for eastern and
north central Arkansas.

For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread
significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately
likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of
a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant
property damage.
